title: About
text:
Lisa May has a PhD in Neuroscience from the University of Oregon and works as a Workflow Coach for Posit Software.
Lisa tends to find the social lives of non-human animals interesting - thus crows and whales as subject matter.

title: Singing Whale
text: Sigh. I really loved this whale, but I screwed up the glazing. So we’ll just say that I learned a lot. Maybe someday I’ll try to reglaze and fire.

title: Mina and the Leaf
text: I’m real proud of this one. Gives just the Emily Dickenson staring into the sky vibes. Based off an actual photo - the leaf was (and is) that big.

title: Stars Cup
text: Gasp. This one gives me the feels. I should make more in this theme.

title: Real Good Hammered Mug
text: It’s not even hammered. I mean…I hit it with a ball tool which I love doing with all my heart.

title: Contact
text: Feel free to reach out to me for inquiries, commissions, or just to say hello at may.lisa2@gmail.com. For purchases, ssually it works well to give me your shipping address, I ship it to you and send you a Venmo request for the cost of the piece + shipping.

title: Just a Crow Wearing Pearls
text: She just likes to wear pearls.

title: Hammered Mug the Second
text: Honestly, the first hammered mug was way better. I was experimenting with thinner slabs to make the mugs lighter, but I’ve learned that means they warp more easily.

title: Tea Cannister
text: The bottom is cool because I used a parmesan cheese jar as a form. :) Also this holds Trader Joe’s teabags just like a can of pringles.

title: Belly Dancer Whale
text: She’s a beautiful dancer, spinning on her belly.

title: Crow Babies
text:
Available for Purchase Price: $45
Email may.lisa2@gmail.com to inquire.

This summer I watched a juvenile crow beg for food while she was standing on food. The begging went on for days. Man, oh man, it really made me empathize with the parents. And crows do it every year! This a set of four small plates is an ode to parental patience and how hard it is to raise kids. :) They’re little plates - perfect for dunking chicken nuggets in ketchup or holding your rings.
